text: ਦਰਸਨ ਕੀ ਮਨਿ ਆਸ ਘਨੇਰੀ ਕੋਈ ਐਸਾ ਸੰਤੁ ਮੋ ਕਉ ਪਿਰਹਿ ਮਿਲਾਵੈ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥

translation.text: My mind's desire for the Blessed Vision of His Darshan is so great. Is there any Saint who can lead me to meet my Beloved? ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: darasan kī man ās ghanērī kōī aisā sant mō kau pirah milāvai .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.author: Guru Arjan Dev
author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

translation.text: The four watches of the day are like the four ages.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. text: ਰੈਣਿ ਭਈ ਤਬ ਅੰਤੁ ਨ ਜਾਨੇ ॥੨॥

translation.text: And when night comes, I think that it shall never end. ||2||

transliteration.text: rain bhaī tab ant n jānē .2.

translation.text: The five demons have joined together, to separate me from my Husband Lord.

translation.text: Wandering and rambling, I cry out and wring my hands. ||3||

text: ਦੁਖਿ ਸੁਖਿ ਸਿਮਰੀ ਤਹ ਮਉਜੂਦੁ ਜਮੁ ਬਪੁਰਾ ਮੋ ਕਉ ਕਹਾ ਡਰਾਈ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥

translation.text: In pain and pleasure, whenever I remember Him, He is present. How can the poor Messenger of Death frighten me now? ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: dukh sukh simarī tah maujūd jam bapurā mō kau kahā darāī .1. rahāu .

text: ਹਰਿ ਮੇਰੀ ਓਟ ਮੈ ਹਰਿ ਕਾ ਤਾਣੁ ॥

author.author: Guru Arjan Dev
author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

text: ਗੁਰੁ ਨਾਨਕੁ ਤੁਠਾ ਮਿਲਿਆ ਹਰਿ ਰਾਇ ॥

translation.text: O Nanak, when the Guru is totally pleased, one meets the Lord, the King.

transliteration.text: gur nānak tuthā miliā har rāi .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

translation.text: Then, the night of one's life passes in peace and natural ease. ||4||17||

translation.text: Showing His Mercy, the Lord has revealed Himself to me.

translation.text: Meeting the True Guru, I have received the perfect wealth. ||1||

translation.text: Gather such a wealth of the Lord, O Siblings of Destiny.

text: ਭਾਹਿ ਨ ਜਾਲੈ ਜਲਿ ਨਹੀ ਡੂਬੈ ਸੰਗੁ ਛੋਡਿ ਕਰਿ ਕਤਹੁ ਨ ਜਾਈ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥

translation.text: It cannot be burned by fire, and water cannot drown it; it does not forsake society, or go anywhere else. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: bhāh n jālai jal nahī dūbai sang shōd kar katah n jāī .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. text: ਤੋਟਿ ਨ ਆਵੈ ਨਿਖੁਟਿ ਨ ਜਾਇ ॥

translation.text: It does not run short, and it does not run out.

transliteration.text: tōt n āvai nikhut n jāi .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. translation.text: Eating and consuming it, the mind remains satisfied. ||2||

text: ਸੋ ਸਚੁ ਸਾਹੁ ਜਿਸੁ ਘਰਿ ਹਰਿ ਧਨੁ ਸੰਚਾਣਾ ॥

translation.text: He is the true banker, who gathers the wealth of the Lord within his own home.

transliteration.text: sō sach sāh jis ghar har dhan sanchānā .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. text: ਇਸੁ ਧਨ ਤੇ ਸਭੁ ਜਗੁ ਵਰਸਾਣਾ ॥੩॥

translation.text: With this wealth, the whole world profits. ||3||

transliteration.text: is dhan tē sabh jag varasānā .3.

text: ਤਿਨਿ ਹਰਿ ਧਨੁ ਪਾਇਆ ਜਿਸੁ ਪੁਰਬ ਲਿਖੇ ਕਾ ਲਹਣਾ ॥

translation.text: He alone receives the Lord's wealth, who is pre-ordained to receive it.

transliteration.text: tin har dhan pāiā jis purab likhē kā lahanā .

text: ਜਨ ਨਾਨਕ ਅੰਤਿ ਵਾਰ ਨਾਮੁ ਗਹਣਾ ॥੪॥੧੮॥

translation.text: O servant Nanak, at that very last moment, the Naam shall be your only decoration. ||4||18||

transliteration.text: jan nānak ant vār nām gahanā .4.18.

text: ਗੋਵਿੰਦ ਭਗਤੁ ਅਸਥਿਰੁ ਹੈ ਥੀਆ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥

translation.text: Only the devotee of the Lord of the Universe becomes stable and permanent. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: gōvind bhagat asathir hai thīā .1. rahāu .
